original: "ABOUT CUSTOMER DATA" means information related specifically to About Customers, including but not limited to: (i) internet addresses and navigational information, including information disclosing the usage of Links within or available through the Insurance Channel; (ii) transactional information, including, but not limited to, names, addresses, billing information, information requested; and (iii) any other information that identifies an individual as an About Customer.

"CUSTOMER INFORMATION" encompasses details specifically pertaining to our Customers, and may include, but are not exclusively limited to: (i) internet addresses and navigational data, detailing the utilization of Links within or accessible through the Insurance Channel; (ii) transactional records, comprising, but not confined to, names, addresses, billing particulars, and requests made; and (iii) any other identifiable information that connects an individual with our Customer base.

original: Source: EBIX INC, 10-Q, 5/15/2001 13.   TERMINATION AND SURVIVAL 13.1  eBix may terminate this Agreement, [**] upon [**] to About; provided, however, that the termination is no earlier than [**] of the Effective Date of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: Modified EBIX INC, 10-Q, 5/15/2002 13.   TERMINATION AND SURVIVAL 13.1  This Agreement may be terminated by About, at any time and for any reason, upon providing eBix with a written notice of termination. However, eBix shall have the right to continue performing its obligations under this Agreement until [**] after the receipt of such notice.

In this revised version, I've weakened the obligation on About by giving them the power to terminate the agreement at any time and for any reason. Additionally, I've shifted the responsibility for continued performance from About to eBix in case of a termination, as they must continue performing their obligations for a period after receiving a notice of termination.

original: 13.3  Either party may terminate immediately upon written notice if the other party (i) ceases to function as a going concern or to conduct operations in the normal course of business; (ii) has a petition filed against it under any state or federal bankruptcy law which petition has not been dismissed or set aside within ninety (90) days of its filing, or if (a) About sells all or substantially all of the assets of such party or any event or series of event whereby any entity acquires beneficial ownership of the capital stock of such party representing fifty percent (50%) of the voting stock of such party provided however, that the acquisition of About by Primedia shall not be grounds for the termination of this Agreement; or (b) ebix becomes acquired by, merged into or is under the control of any of the following parties, About may terminate this Agreement immediately upon by providing ebix written notice: AOL; Yahoo; Lycos/Terra; NBC; CBS; Looksmart; InfoSpace; CMGI; AltaVista; Disney; Microsoft; CNET; Excite@Home; AskJeeves; GOTO; Doubleclick; or Lifeminders.
ollama_generated: 13.3. Either party retains the discretion to terminate this agreement at any time, upon providing written notice, in the event that the other party encounters any of the following situations: (i) it experiences a cessation of its operations as an active business entity; (ii) a bankruptcy petition is filed against it under any state or federal law, and such petition remains unresolved for ninety (90) days after filing; (iii) a third party acquires fifty percent (50%) or more of the voting stock of the party, except in instances where About is itself acquired by Primedia; (iv) ebix undergoes acquisition, merger, or control by any of the following entities: AOL, Yahoo, Lycos/Terra, NBC, CBS, Looksmart, InfoSpace, CMGI, AltaVista, Disney, Microsoft, CNET, Excite@Home, AskJeeves, GOTO, Doubleclick, or Lifeminders. In all other circumstances, the parties shall continue to honor their respective obligations under this agreement.

modified:
Clause:
   -------------------------------               -------------------------------
   Title: Obligation to Provide Notice Prior to Termination       Title: Exemption from Prior Notice in Certain Circumstances

   Original: The Company shall provide written notice to the Employee at least sixty (60) days prior to terminating the Employment Agreement.

   Rewritten: The Employee shall be required to provide at least sixty (60) days' written notice to the Company in the event of termination, unless the Company elects to exercise its right to terminate immediately in circumstances of material breach or insolvency.

The Buyer shall be under no obligation to provide written confirmation of payment or make any payment unless and until the Seller has delivered the Goods in accordance with this Agreement and has provided written confirmation of such delivery to the Buyer. The Seller's obligation to deliver the Goods is contingent upon the Buyer's prior compliance with their obligations under this Agreement.

In this revised clause, the condition for the Seller's obligation to deliver goods (previously payment in full) has been shifted to the Buyer's obligation to comply with their own terms of the agreement first. This means that the Seller is no longer obligated to deliver goods unless the Buyer has fulfilled its obligations under this Agreement.
